item.description:
As part of Secular Service Day, we're pitching in to help the Humanists of BU show their secular service-mindedness, by joining them in a clean-up of the Charles River Esplanade. We'll be gathering outside BU's Marsh Chapel (http://www.bu.edu/cha..., before heading heading over the footbridge across Storrow Drive, to remove rubbish and other out-of-context objects from the park along the river.

Meet at the Chapel before 1 in order to go over to the Esplanade as a group at 1.

Trash bags, latex, gloves, coffee and doughnuts will be provided. Bring your own elbow grease. Feel free to wear a blasphemous shirt to advertise to passerby: yes, Virginia, non-believers do like to help.

In case of inclement weather, all those who RSVP yes will be emailed by Saturday afternoon about a cancellation.
item.name: Pitching in for Secular Service Day: Charles River pick-up
